intro: Sisymbrium erucastrum, commonly known as the narrowleaf tansy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellow flowers. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture. Sisymbrium erucastrum is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environments and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
